poem:
The Prince of Darkness Dances On

In silence,  
the thunder fades—  
a chord unstruck,  
a howl wrapped in  
morning fog.

Yet his shadow sweats  
the stage,  
where rubber soles  
crack like bones on  
the black Sabbath—  
a song unsung,  
but lived.  
  
In the heart's echo—  
Ozzy still  
roars.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ozzy Osbourne, Black Sabbath frontman and icon of British heavy metal, dies aged 76 Ozzy Osbourne, whose gleeful “Prince of Darkness” image made him one of the most iconic rock frontmen of all time, has died aged 76. A statement from the Osbourne family reads: “It is with more sadness than mere words can convey that we have to report that our beloved Ozzy Osbourne has passed away this morning. He was with his family". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Ozzy Osbourne, Black Sabbath frontman and icon of British heavy metal, dies aged 76 Ozzy Osbourne, whose gleeful “Prince of Darkness” image made him one of the most iconic rock frontmen of all time, has died aged 76. A statement from the Osbourne family reads: “It is with more sadness than mere words can convey that we have to report that our beloved Ozzy Osbourne has passed away this morning. He was with his family
